frameDefinitions: A Device or machine is put in (or out of) service either by a volitional Agent or by a Cause event or force acting on the Device.
This frame describes either the creation of a Flame by a Kindler or non-sentient Cause, or the igniting of Flammables by a Kindler or a Cause.
The Fastener is an artifact created to close a Container (e.g. coat, jar).
A System interacts with the environment (which may include a volitional agent) and goes into operation in accordance with its intended purpose.
A Cause triggers a System to operate in accordance with its intended purpose.
frameExamples: The laborer realized that he <t>activated</t> the machine but did not know how to stop it.
Taliban militants recently <t>set fire</t> to several schools.
The door <t>seal</t> prevented air from getting in and the kids' screams from getting out.
The alarm <t>went off</t> as she walked through the entrance.
Smoking a cigarette will normally not <t>set off</t> a smoke alarm.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Device</fen> or machine that is in or out of operation.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who changes the operational state of the <fen>Device</fen>.
<fen>Cause</fen> identifies the non-agentive force that causes the <fen>Device</fen> to begin to operate.
The <fen>Time</fen> when a <fen>Device</fen> is put into or out of operation.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Device</fen> is put into or out of operation.
The <fen>Kindler</fen> is the person performing the intentional act.
The <fen>Flame</fen> is what is created by the Kindler.
The Flamables is the the object that is set on fire by the Kindler.
The cause of the fire.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event takes place.
This role identifies the item that is closed with the <fen>Fastener</fen>.
The artifact created to close a <fen>Container</fen>.
This role identifies the active zone of the container where the <fen>Fastener</fen> is located.
The <fen>System</fen> interacts with the environment and activates.
The time when the <fen>System</fen> triggers.
Where the <fen>System</fen> goes off.
The <fen>Cause</fen> interacts with the <fen>System</fen> such that conditions are met for the <fen>System</fen> to operate.
The <fen>System</fen> interacts with or detects the <fen>Cause</fen> and activates.
An entity which participates in a <fen>Cause</fen>, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not.
The time when the triggering takes place.
Where the triggering takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The night lights</fex> were turned on in the secondary school.
Instantly <fex>Sue</fex> activated the commlink on the wall.
He was in his stocking feet while standing in the bayou that formed when <fex>the wind</fex> turned the shower on in that one upstairs bathroom.
My dad turned the lights on for me <fex>at 10 o'clock</fex>
Suddenly, the lights got turned on <fex>on the Jamaica road bridge</fex>.
<fex>Mark</fex> started the fire with a magnifying glass.
Oscar started <fex>the fire</fex>.
Tracy set <fex>the couch</fex> on fire.
<fex>A spark</fex> ignited the curtains.
On Friday night, many men will simply elect to remove their tie and unbutton their top <fex>shirt</fex> button.
Man, I have just bought the exact same belt <fex><t>buckle</t></fex> and it won't open.
We couldn't close the <fex>tent flap</fex> zipper and a lot of flies came in .
<fex>The device</fex> triggered as she walked through the arch.
The alarm went off <fex>at three o'clock today</fex>.
Police came running downstairs when the metal detector went off <fex>at the county courthouse</fex>.
<fex>His presence</fex> set off the motion alarms.
They let him through even though something triggered <fex>the metal detector</fex>?
<fex>She</fex> set off the silent alarm before being shoved into the middle of the lobby.
Three bombs were set off <fex>at three o'clock today</fex>.
Police came running downstairs when someone set off the metal detector <fex>at the county courthouse</fex>.
